title: Though, If, Even Though, Even If

questions.question: ………………………. I was not feeling well, I enjoyed the party.
questions.description: Even though is a more emphatic version of though. It is possible in situations where though is also correct.

questions.question: …………………………. she apologizes, we cannot take her back.
questions.description: Even if refers to the present or future. Even though has a past reference.

questions.question: …………………………… you are busy, I will wait outside.
……………………………. he is quite busy, he always finds time for his family.
…………………………. that is your decision, there is nothing that I can do.
…………………………. we suffered a crushing defeat, we didn’t lose hope.
questions.description: Even though is a more emphatic form of though. They are both possible here.

questions.question: ………………………….. she was ill, she refused to take the medication.
…………………………… it was an expensive laptop, I bought it.
questions.description: Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: ……………………………. you forbid me, I will go.
……………………………. they tried hard, they could not save him.
…………………………. you work hard now, it is not possible to catch up with them.
questions.description: Even if used to talk about situations that are true in the present or future.

questions.question: …………………………… I had studied well, I could not get good marks.
questions.description: Even though is an emphatic form of though.
